business.headline: India to monitor negotiations before taking a call on US tariffs: Finance MinisterFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal is currently in the United States for discussions, and India will wait for the outcome before taking a stance.
L&T introduces one-day paid menstrual leave for women employeesThe announcement was made by Chairman and Managing Director S N Subrahmanyan during an event held to mark International Women's Day.

Bitcoin prices fall 5% after Donald Trump orders US strategic reserveBitcoin prices dropped over 5% a day before Donald Trump is set to meet with top executives from the cryptocurrency industry at the White House.

Gold loans under under scanner as RBI plans stricter norms for lenders: Report The RBI wants banks and non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) to conduct deeper background checks on borrowers and verify the ownership of the gold being pledged.
DA hike? Will central government employees receive good news before Holi?The government reviews DA twice a year; the January hike is announced around Holi, while July revision is around Diwali.

5 special fixed deposits offering up to 8.05% interest. Check details  These fixed deposits are available only for a limited period, with the last date for investing in these schemes being March 31, 2025.
Sensex rises 600 points, Nifty nears 22,550 as auto and metal stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 609.86 points to close at 74,340.09, while the NSE Nifty50 added 207.40 points to end at 22,544.70.

Britannia Industries CEO Rajneet Singh Kohli resignsKohli submitted his resignation on March 5, 2025, and the Board of Directors has taken note of it through a circular resolution passed on March 6, 2025. He will be relieved from his duties at the close of business hours on March 14, 2025.

You don't need employer's permission for these EPF account changesIf your UAN is already linked to Aadhaar, you can update personal details like name, date of birth, gender, nationality, parents' names, marital status, spouse's name, date of joining, and date of leaving, all without submitting any documents.

Sensex gains 600 points: Why is stock market rising despite early losses?Stock market gains: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 475.17 points to 74,205.40, while the NSE Nifty50 added 171.30 points to 22,508.60 as of 2:20 PM.

Infosys mandates 10-day office attendance, to track compliance: ReportInfosys has informed its technology workforce that a new system will track attendance and limit the number of work-from-home (WFH) days they can apply for.

Indian jewellers worry as Trump's reciprocal tariffs spark job loss fears: ReportKey Indian exports to the US include cut and polished diamonds, studded gold jewellery, plain gold jewellery, lab-grown diamonds, and silver jewellery.

Sensex, Nifty rally for 2nd straight day: Is D-Street ready for a bull run?The two-day recovery rally on Dalal Street, though encouraging, comes amid global uncertainty, particularly concerns over a possible trade war. While some experts remain cautious about calling this a full-fledged market recovery, they acknowledge that conditions are improving for a potential uptrend.

How much will Donald Trump's reciprocal tariffs cost India?During a joint session of the US Congress, President Donald Trump said that other countries have charged the US high tariffs for years, and it was time to respond.

Delhi Mahila Samriddhi Scheme: Check if you are eligible for Rs 2,500 monthly aidThe Delhi government will launch an online portal where women can submit their applications. The IT department is also developing special software to verify eligibility.

US may push India for zero tariffs on nearly all goods: Report The development comes as US President Donald Trump keeps criticising India over what he calls 'unfair' trade practices. He recently announced that reciprocal tariffs would kick in on April 2 and made it clear that India wouldn't be getting any special treatment.

Jindal Group's Sajjan Jindal says Elon Musk's Tesla won't succeed IndiaSajjan Jindal doubts Elon Musk's Tesla can thrive in India, but with office space secured and hiring underway, Musk seems determined to challenge local giants like Tata and Mahindra.

Nithin Kamath doesn't want you to stop SIPs amid market correction. Here's whyZerodha Founder and CEO Nithin Kamath believes this is not the right time to stop systematic investment plans (SIPs) despite the market correction on Dalal Street.

Jack Daniel's maker says Canada pulling US alcohol off shelves worse than tariffSeveral Canadian provinces have taken US liquor off store shelves as part of retaliatory measures against President Donald Trump's tariffs.

US eyes duty-free car exports to India as Tesla's entry nears: Report Tesla CEO Elon Musk has previously criticised the tariffs put by India on the import of cars from the US, calling them among the highest in the world.

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath wins EY Entrepreneur of the Year Award 2024A self-made entrepreneur, Kamath has not only bootstrapped Zerodha to a billion-dollar valuation but also actively supports start-ups in fintech and climate space, and advocates for social initiatives.

Sensex, Nifty rise for second consecutive day led by auto stocks; RIL gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 325.45 points to 74,055.68, while the NSE Nifty50 added 99.05 points to 22,436.35 as of 9:20 AM.
EPF withdrawal via UPI and ATMs coming soon. All you need to knowThis new facility will allow EPF members to withdraw their savings instantly using UPI platforms like GPay, PhonePe, and Paytm.
ITR-1 (Sahaj) vs ITR-4 (Sugam): Check key differences and eligibility Commonly known as the Sahaj form, ITR-1 is a simple form for individuals with simple income sources.

Want to track old mutual funds investments? Here's what you need to doWith millions of unclaimed folios, the Mitra platform aims to simplify the process of finding and reclaiming lost mutual fund investments.

Sensex ends 740 points higher, Nifty snaps 10-day losing streakThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 740.30 points higher to 73,730.23 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 254.65 points lower at 22,337.30.

Looking for better returns than fixed deposits? Check these 3 investment optionsWith the RBI announcing a repo rate cut, banks have lowered fixed deposit rates, prompting investors to look for better alternatives.

Sensex surges 900 points: Is Dalal Street's losing streak finally over?Today's relief rally in domestic equities is offering some much-needed respite to traders. But with trade tensions heating up, the volatility isn't going away anytime soon. Is this the beginning of a rebound or just a temporary surge?

New income tax bill proposes allowing officers access to your email, social mediaThe new bill gives tax officers the authority to access computers, emails, and social media accounts, raising privacy concerns.

M&M shares rise over 4% after UBS upgrade. 3 things investors should know M&M stock price: The brokerage said the recent 19% correction in M&M's share price, compared to Nifty Auto's 13% decline, was an overreaction to EV-related concerns.

Services sector growth accelerates in February backed by strong demandHSBC's final India services Purchasing Managers' Index, compiled by S&P Global, rose to 59.0 in February from January's 26-month low of 56.5 but was lower than a preliminary estimate of 61.1.

What are reciprocal tariffs that Donald Trump mentioned in Congress address?US President Donald Trump announced the implementation of reciprocal tariffs starting next month while addressing a joint session of the US Congress.

Sensex surges 800 points. Why is the stock market rising today?Today's rebound has brought much-needed relief to traders on Dalal Street, reviving hopes of a broader recovery in the days ahead. Here's what's driving the rally and whether the downturn has bottomed out.

Explained: Why Coforge shares jumped nearly 10% todayCoforge share price: The stock reached an intraday high of Rs 7,924.50 in early trade and was up 8.65% to Rs 7,827.25 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 10:20 am.

Sensex, Nifty bounce back as IT stocks rally; investors remain waryThe Nifty IT index jumped nearly 2%, buoyed by a 10 % surge in Coforge after it signed a 13-year, $1.56 billion deal with Sabre Corp.

Struggling to find your old mutual fund investments? Let Sebi's Mitra help With over 7.5 million inactive folios across different asset management companies (AMCs), Mitra is designed to help investors recover their forgotten investments.
Does marriage impact your credit score? All you need to know While regular payments can improve both scores, any late or default on payments can considerably impact both the scores.

India's exports under pressure as US and EU tighten trade policiesUS President Donald Trump's plan to impose reciprocal tariffs from April is a major concern for Indian exporters, particularly in sectors like automobiles, agriculture, and manufacturing.

Nifty falls for 10th straight day, longest daily losing streak since 1996 launchNifty has registered a 10-day losing streak amid multiple triggers, including relentless selling by foreign investors and fears of an escalating trade war.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as trade war fears keep investors on edgeThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 96.01 points lower at 72,989.93 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 36.65 points to 22,082.65.

entertainment.headline: Friends actor recalls 'toxic environment' on set: I had become so race-consciousActor Stephen Park shared his negative experiences on the set of Friends, highlighting racial insensitivity. He recalled an incident involving an assistant director's offensive remarks towards fellow actor James Hong.

BB 17's Ayesha Khan faints while shooting, video goes viralBigg Boss 17 fae Ayesha Khan fainted on the sets of her upcoming project. Reportedly, the incident took place on Kapil Sharma's Kis Kisko Pyaar Karun set.

Nora Fatehi, Jason Durelo teach Kelly Clarkson Snake hook step. WatchKelly Clarkson welcomed Nora Fatehi and Jason Derulo on her talk show, where they showcased their latest hit, Snake, and even taught Kelly the hook step.

Lisa Kudrow's No Good Deed: This dark comedy could have been darker and funnierLisa Kudrow and Ray Romano are beloved comedic actors. And they deserved better treatment than Netflix's No Good Deed, which is fine at best. The series is currently streaming on the OTT platform.

With Love, Meghan review: You are neither fancy nor rich enough for Markle's show Released-Wed Mar 05, 2025With Love, Meghan could have been a lovely show about cooking and lifestyle, but it becomes a window into Markle's pretentiousness. It can't do away with its elitism, the one thing that Markle stood against during her stint at the royal palace.

Netflix cancels Noah Centineo-led The Recruit after 2 seasonsStreaming giant Netflix has cancelled actor Noah Centineo-starrer The Recruit after only two seasons. The news was recently confirmed by the OTT platform.

Daredevil Born Again review: An uneven but triumphant return of Hell's Kitchen's devilReleased-Wed Mar 05, 2025Matt Murdock is back as Hell's Kitchen's favourite vigilante in Marvel Studios' Daredevil Born Again. The show had its two-episode premiere on March 5 and can be streamed on JioHotstar.

Ali Fazal trains 7 hours a day for Rakht Brahmand, learns ancient martial artsAli Fazal undergoes 7-hour daily training, learning martial arts and perfecting diction for Rakht Brahmand. He calls the process "demanding but rewarding." The series also stars Samantha Ruth Prabhu.
Bigg Boss 17's Anurag Dobhal gets engaged to girlfriend RitikaBigg Boss 17's Anurag Dobhal got engaged to his girlfriend Ritika Chauhan. The vlogger shared pictures on Instagram on March 5.

Madhavan, Nayanthara, Siddharth's Netflix film Test to premiere on April 4Madhavan, Nayanthara, and Siddharth star in Test, a Tamil Netflix film exploring life's biggest challenges beyond cricket. Directed by S. Sashikanth, it will stream from April 4.

Liam Payne's girlfriend breaks down remembering singer, says 'can't fully accept'One Direction singer Liam Payne's untimely demise has left his girlfriend Kate Cassidy grappling with grief. In a heartfelt interview, she talked about her struggles and healing journey.

Actor Parambrata jokes about playing a cop ahead of Khakee: The Bengal ChapterActor Parambrata Chattopadhyay recently joked about playing a police officer ahead of his Netflix series, Khakee: The Bengal Chapter. The actor even shared reasons behind nodding to feature in the political drama.

Khakee The Bengal Chapter trailer: Neeraj Pandey show dives into politics, crimeThe trailer for Khakee The Bengal Chapter was unveiled on March 5. The show promises a riveting series filled with action, drama, and political intrigue.
K-pop group SEVENTEEN member Wonwoo to enlist in military in AprilSEVENTEEN's Wonwoo is set to begin his mandatory military service in April, as confirmed by Pledis Entertainment.

Lollapalooza 2025: Shawn Mendes, Louis Tomlinson to make India debutLollapalooza India is making a grand return in 2025 at Mumbai's Mahalaxmi Racecourse. With an eclectic lineup featuring Green Day, Shawn Mendes, and more, this festival promises an unforgettable musical experience.

Actor Sumbul Touqeer blasts trolls for body-shaming: Never been more madTelevision actor Sumbul Touqeer Khan has addressed the body-shaming and trolling she faced in a recent social media post. She clarified that her weight gain was due to medication and urged trolls to stop their unwarranted comments.

With Love, Meghan first reviews: Meghan Markle's show called queasy, unlovableIn 'With Love, Meghan', Meghan Markle arranges flowers, cooks delectable exquisite food with her celebrity friends, and gives stunning glimpses of her gorgeous Montecito house with a sprawling ocean view.

Severance creator Ben Stiller requested Obama for cameo in show. Here's how it wentSeverance creator and actor Ben Stiller wanted former US President Barack Obama to appear in his acclaimed Apple TV show, Severance. However, his request was politely turned down.

Black Doves: Keira Knightley show is essential viewing for thriller enthusiastsBritish stars Keira Knightley and Ben Whishaw's thriller series Black Doves is both relentless and rewarding. The underrated gem is currently streaming on Netflix.
Sana Khan faces backlash after asking Sambhavna Seth to wear burqa for her podcastSana Khan found herself in the spotlight after a video of her asking Sambhavna Seth to wear a burqa went viral.

Aashram 3 Part 2: Aaditi Pohankar's Pammi outshines Bobby Deol's Baba NiralaAaditi Pohankar's character as Pammi has garnered her immense love and appreciation from fans. Her fierce portrayal and her quest to take revenge against Bobby Deol's Baba Nirala truly makes her the hero of the series.

Bobby Deol had a vertigo attack while promoting Aashram: Was very nervousActor Bobby Deol recently revealed that he suffered from a vertigo attack while promoting his popular show Aashram. The actor is currently seen in the latest season of the show, which is streaming on MX Player.

Explained: The plagiarism controversy around BLACKPINK's Jennie's new song BLACKPINK member Jennie Kim released the teaser of her new single, 'Like Jennie', on social media, and several social media users, especially Indians, found it quite similar to Alia Bhatt's theme song from 'Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani'.

Kanye West's wife Bianca goes nude again after controversial Grammy outingKanye West's wife Bianca Censori went nude for a photoshoot. This comes a month after her controversial 'nude' outfit at the Grammys.

Actor Shoaib Ibrahim reacts to divorce rumours: Dipika ne diya mujhe dhokhaTelevision couple, Dipika Kakar and Shoaib Ibrahim have found themselves at the center of the separation rumours. The two addressed the same in their new vlog on YouTube.

Shonali Bose on DU, Miranda House's objection to Ziddi Girls: It was heartbreakingPrime Video's Ziddi Girls faced backlash from sections of Delhi University and Miranda House students over perceived negative portrayal, but director Shonali Bose clarifies the trailer was misunderstood and most students ultimately enjoyed the show.

Anora OTT release: When and where to watch the Oscar-winning Best FilmThe Oscar-winning film 'Anora' is set to stream on JioHotstar from March 17. Directed by Sean Baker and starring Mikey Madison, who won Best Actress, the movie offers a thought-provoking narrative.
Singer Dolly Parton's husband Carl Dean dies at 82Carl Dean, husband of Dolly Parton and inspiration for her hit song, Jolene, has died at the age of 82.

Blackpink's Lisa on her new album Alter Ego: Want people to feel empoweredLisa of Blackpink recently spoke about her new solo album, Alter Ego. In a virtual panel discussion, the singer shared her desire to make listeners feel empowered with her new album.

Taarak Mehta actor Deepti Sadhwani turns showstopper at Milan Fashion WeekTaarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah actor Deepti Sadhwani turned showstopper at Milan Fashion Week. The actor shared stunning photos from her rampwalk.

Kaam Idhar Udhar Hogaya: YouTuber Ashish Chanchlani on India's Got Latent rowYouTuber Ashish Chanchlani got emotional in his first video after his appearance on comedian Samay Raina's India's Got Latent show.

Maharani 4 teaser: Huma Qureshi returns as Rani Bharti to safeguard BiharActor Huma Qureshi is set to return as Rani Bharti in Maharani Season 4. The makers announced the news with the teaser of the upcoming gripping series.

TV show Tenali Rama set catches fire, shoot haltedA fire broke out on the set of TV show Tenali Rama due to a generator malfunction, halting production. There were no casualties, but the set suffered damage and repairs are underway.

Be Happy: Abhishek Bachchan reunites with Ludo co-actor Inayat in feel-good filmThe trailer of Abhishek Bachchan and Inayat Verma's upcoming dance-drama Be Happy was released today. Directed by Remo D'Souza, the heartfelt film will premiere on Prime Video on March 14.

BTS' J-hope's Seoul concert: New song, fan proposal and special appearance by JinBTS member and rapper J-hope recently held a concert in Seoul which was attended by his close friend and singer Kim Seokjin (Jin). The concert was one big event for the fans as it consisted of many other surprises besides the central performance by the artiste.

Khakee The Bengal Chapter: Jeet and Prosenjit announce release date with fun clipThe next installment of Netflix's critically acclaimed thriller series Khakee, Khakee: The Bengal Chapter will premiere on Netflix in March. The makers of the show announced its release date with a fun video.

Anupamaa actor Sudhanshu Pandey breaks silence on rumoured feud with Rupali GangulyActor Sudhanshu Pandey has addressed the ongoing rumours about a feud with his Anupamaa co-star Rupali Ganguly. In an interview, he clarified the situation and dismissed the speculations.

BRIT Awards 2025: Charli XCX wins album of the year, full winners list hereCharli XCX emerged as a major winner at the Brit Awards 2025, securing multiple accolades. Artists including Sabrina Carpenter and Billie Eilish also took home some of the biggest awards of the night.

Honey Singh's Millionaire Delhi concert: A night of nostalgia, iconic hitsHoney Singh's Delhi concert was packed with nostalgic hits, emotional tributes, surprise guests, and exclusive remixes. The rapper promised bigger things ahead as his Millionaire Tour continues.

Justin Bieber celebrates 31st birthday with family, shares rare pics of son JackPop sensation Justin Bieber marked his 31st birthday with a heartwarming family gathering. He shared rare photos with wife Hailey and their son Jack, capturing the joyous occasion.

general news.headline: 26/11 accused Tahawwur Rana's plea to pause extradition rejected by US courtTahawwur Rana's extradition was approved by US President Donald Trump during Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Washington last month. Rana, 63, is currently lodged at a jail in Los Angeles.

After praise for counterterrorism, Trump set to impose travel ban on Pak: ReportThe Donald Trump administration is set to impose travel on Pakistan and Afghanistan following a review of countries' security and vetting risks. The ban is set to take effect as soon as next week.

Yogi Adityanath, Rekha Gupta to Aamir Khan: Powerhouses to unite at Conclave 2025The India Today Conclave, scheduled for March 7-8 in Delhi, will see an eclectic mix of politicians, cinema stars, sportspersons, entrepreneurs, and cultural icons delve into this year's theme - 'Age of Acceleration'.

Islam a scientific religion: Congress leader's take on Mohammed Shami's roza rowCongress leader Shama Mohamed defended Indian pacer Mohammed Shami after Maulana Shahabuddin Razvi Bareilvi called him a "criminal" for skipping roza during India's Champions Trophy semi-final against Australia.

How Mona hid the sona. Gold smugglers and their sneaky tricksRanya Rao, actor and daughter of a top police officer, was nabbed while trying to smuggle gold into India. She was concealing gold bars in her clothing. Gold is among the top items smuggled into India, and in recent times, smugglers have become innovative and found new ways to sneak in the precious metal into India.

Khalistani thugs: UK MP raises alarm over S Jaishankar's London security breachThe incident took place in London on March 6 when a protester ran in front of S Jaishankar's stationary car, waving a flag, but, according to UK Police, was "quickly intercepted by officers and moved out of the way".

Watch: Elon Musk's Starship explodes in space, crashes over BahamasThe Starship rocket, designed to be the most powerful ever built, was intended to conduct a suborbital flight, deploying four dummy Starlink satellites and testing reentry maneuvers.

Holi comes once a year, Friday namaz 52 times: UP cop's remark triggers rowA Sambhal police officer's advice for those uncomfortable with Holi colours to stay indoors has sparked political backlash, with opposition leaders condemning the remarks as biased and demanding action.

Watch: Air Force's C-17 Globemaster lands on Kargil airstrip for first time The C-17's ability to carry over 25 tonnes - up to 35 tonnes in winter - will enhance the IAF's transport capacity, making it easier to move troops and military supplies to posts near the Line of Actual Control.

Trump's message for stranded Sunita Williams: We love you, coming up to get youSunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, who flew to the International Space Station on Boeing's faulty Starliner capsule in June 2024, will now have to wait until their replacements arrive next week before they can check out later this month.

Iron nails driven into feet, woman's battered body turns up on Bihar roadsideA woman's body was found in Bihar's Nalanda district with multiple injuries and nails driven into her feet. Police are investigating all angles and seeking public help in identifying her. A post-mortem will aid the inquiry.

After Mexico, Trump pauses tariffs on some Canadian goods US President Donald Trump suspended 25 per cent tariffs on Canadian and Mexican goods until April 2. Canada delayed retaliatory tariffs. The move follows concerns over trade uncertainty, inflation, and economic slowdown. Markets reacted negatively.

BJP MP Tejasvi Surya marries Carnatic singer Sivasri Skandaprasad in BengaluruBJP MP Tejasvi Surya married Carnatic singer Sivasri Skandaprasad in a traditional ceremony in Bengaluru, attended by top BJP leaders, with images from the event widely shared on social media.

Trudeau largely caused tariff issue, now using it as re-election tactic: TrumpUS President Donald Trump accused Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of being responsible for the 25 per cent tariff on Canada and using it as an election tactic to secure re-election.

Israel rescues 10 Indian construction workers from West BankTen Indian construction workers were rescued from a West Bank village after being held for over a month. Israeli authorities said Palestinians seized their passports for illegal border crossings. The workers are now in a safe location.

Take back areas under China as well: Omar Abdullah after Jaishankar's PoK remarkS Jaishankar, at a London event, said the Kashmir dispute will be resolved after the "return of the stolen part" under Pakistan. Omar Abdullah asks what is stopping the Centre from reclaiming it.

Baywatch actor Pamela Bach, ex-wife of David Hasselhoff, dies by suicide at 62Actor Pamela Bach, aged 62, was found at her home in Hollywood Hills on March 5. The police confirmed that she died by suicide. She was the ex-wife of David Hasselhoff.

Watch: SpaceX catches Super Heavy rocket falling from spaceThe Super Heavy booster, after executing a boostback burn, was caught by the giant metal arms of the launch tower, known as Mechazilla, at Starbase in Texas.

PM Modi receives top Barbados award for 'strategic leadership' in Covid crisisPrime Minister Narendra Modi received the 'Honorary Order of Freedom of Barbados' for his leadership during the Covid-19 pandemic. Minister Pabitra Margherita accepted the award in Bridgetown, highlighting India-Barbados ties and international cooperation.

Actor Ranya Rao's first photo in custody surfaces after arrest for gold smugglingKannada actor Ranya Rao's first photo in custody emerged on Thursday as she remains in DRI custody after being caught smuggling 14.2 kg of gold worth Rs 12.86 crore.

Karnataka bodybuilder bride's wedding look video goes viral with 7 million viewsEmbracing both tradition and strength, Chitra Purushotham flaunted her muscular physique while dressed in an elegant yellow and blue Kanjivaram saree.

Pope Francis sends first audio message from hospital, thanks well-wishersA brief, two-line message recorded by Francis from Rome's Gemelli hospital earlier on Thursday was played during a nightly prayer service for the pope in St Peter's Square at the Vatican.

Unacceptable: UK condemns security breach during S Jaishankar's visitOn Wednesday, as Jaishankar was leaving the Chatham House venue, after a discussion, a man ran toward his car and tore the Indian national flag in front of police officers.

'Pawned mother's gold': Boatman who earned crores during Maha Kumbh recalls gamblePintu Mallah, a struggling boatman, risked everything for Maha Kumbh 2025. His gamble paid off, earning his family Rs 30 crore and praise from Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath.

Suhana Khan, Agastya Nanda dine out with Shweta Bachchan amid dating rumoursSuhana Khan and Agastya Nanda dined out with Shweta Bachchan, avoiding paparazzi. The rumoured couple previously celebrated New Year together.

Hrithik Roshan is ex-wife Sussanne's biggest cheerleader, attends event in HyderabadHrithik Roshan is his ex-wife Sussanne Khan's biggest cheerleader. As they continue to support each other, Hrithik recently attended the launch of Sussanne's interior design venture in Hyderabad.

Baywatch actor Pamela Bach, ex-wife of David Hasselhoff, dies by suicide at 62Actor Pamela Bach, aged 62, was found at her home in Hollywood Hills on March 5. The police confirmed that she died by suicide. She was the ex-wife of David Hasselhoff.

Govinda's former secretary dies, actor bids tearful goodbye at funeralActor Govinda's former secretary Shashi Prabhu died at his Mumbai residence on March 6. The actor rushed to be by his family's side and was in tears at his funeral.

sports.headline: Suryakumar defends Rohit amid 'captaincy' row: Led us to 4 ICC FinalsSuryakumar Yadav defended Rohit Sharma against criticism, highlighting his leadership in guiding India to four ICC finals. He reminded of Rohit leading India to the 2024 T20 World Cup triumph, as the team gears up for the Champions Trophy final against New Zealand.

England Cricket Board issues apology for 'ill-judged' Pope Francis jokeThe England and Wales Cricket Board faced backlash after joking about Pope Francis "loving the Ashes" in response to his Ash Wednesday message. The post was deleted, and ECB issued an apology for the insensitivity.

IND vs NZ: Virat Kohli's calmness gives Gautam Gambhir's India its ODI identityIn an era when every team needs to have an 'identity', India's ODI team under Gautam Gambhir is deriving its spirit from the calmness of Virat Kohli. The star batter has been in sensational form for India in the Champions Trophy.

UP Warriorz all but knocked out as Matthews, Kerr power MI to 6-wicket winHayley Matthews smashed a 46-ball 68, while Amelia Kerr registered her best figures of 5/38 as Mumbai Indians stormed to a six-wicket win over UP Warriorz in the Women's Premier League.

Mitchell Santner banking on form ahead of final, says extra travel part of jobNew Zealand skipper Mitchell Santner said that he was banking on his team's form ahead of the Champions Trophy final against India. New Zealand beat South Africa in a high-scoring contest to reach the summit clash.

Champions Trophy 2025 Final: ICC announces umpiring line-upPaul Reiffel and Richard Illingworth, two of the most respected names amongst the umpires are set to officiate the Champions Trophy Final between India and New Zealand on Sunday, March 9.

Champions Trophy: Team flops. Did Pakistan fare better as hosts?Pakistan are not playing the final of an ICC tournament, that they hosted after much drama. While their cricket team has been a failure, how did Pakistan do as the hosts of the Champions Trophy 2025?

Sunil Chhetri comes out of international retirement, to play in FIFA's March windowSunil Chhetri has performed a retirement U-turn as he will be back in India colours during the March international window, AIFF announced on March 6. Chhetri retired from football in 2024.

Ben Stokes as England white-ball captain? Rob Key says 'nothing's off the table'England's managing director of men's cricket Rob Key has hinted that Ben Stokes could be an option to be the new white-ball captain after their exit from the Champions Trophy. Jos Buttler stepped down from his role as captain following their exit from the tournament.

Shreyas ready to be India's X-factor in Champions Trophy final vs New ZealandWith an impeccable record against New Zealand in ODIs, Shreyas Iyer is all set to be India's X-factor in the final of the Champions Trophy on March 9. Shreyas goes up a gear against the Blackcaps when it comes to ICC events, as he has shown in the recent past.

Shreyas goes up a gear against the Blackcaps when it comes to ICC events, as he has shown in the recent past.

India not at 100 percent despite reaching Champions Trophy final: Sunil GavaskarSunil Gavaskar feels that India are still not operating at their full potential despite reaching the final of the Champions Trophy 2025. India will face New Zealand in the summit clash on March 9 in Dubai.

No one should take New Zealand for granted in final against India: Sunil GavaskarSunil Gavaskar has claimed that no one should be taking New Zealand for granted in the Champions Trophy final clash against India on March 9. Gavaskar feels that the clash on Sunday will be different from their previous clash during the Group stages.

Why Hardik Pandya was 'laughing inside' during high-pressure semi-final chaseHardik Pandya revealed that he was 'laughing' at the tensed Indian dressing room during the high-pressure run-chase against Australia in the semi-final of the Champions Trophy 2025. Hardik played a match-winning 28 off 24 balls to get India over the line.

David Miller on frequent travel between Pakistan and Dubai: It was not niceSouth Africa batter David Miller has said that it was not nice to shuttle between Pakistan and Dubai for the Champions Trophy. Miller opened up on the hassle of travelling right after playing a match in Pakistan and then flying back again after the draw for semis were finalised.

Why are sleeveless jerseys banned from presentation ceremonies? IPL 2025: The BCCI has introduced SOPs for all the 10 teams, one of which is prohibiting players from wearing 'floppies and sleeveless jerseys' at post-match presentation ceremonies.

Indian wrestler Vinesh Phogat announces pregnancy: A new chapter in our storyIndian wrestler Vinesh Phogat has announced that she is expecting her first child with husband Somvir Rathee on her official Instagram account on Thursday, March 6. Vinesh announced her retirement from wrestling in 2024.

Don't try anything extra: When MS Dhoni calmed down a debuting Rahul TripathiRahul Tripathi recalled the moment when MS Dhoni helped him calm down ahead of his IPL debut in 2017. Dhoni and Tripathi were playing for Rising Pune Super Giants at that time in the IPL.

SRH rope in South Africa all-rounder for injured Brydon Carse IPL 2025: South African all-rounder Wiaan Mulder has replaced the injured Brydon Carse in the Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) for the upcoming edition of the tournament.

Mohammed Shami concedes India's Dubai advantage, differs from Rohit, GambhirIndian pacer Mohammed Shami gave a contrasting take about India having an advantage in Dubai as compared to captain Rohit Sharma and Gautam Gambhir. Shami admitted that India does have an advantage playing Dubai.

Miller remains 'clutch' as South Africa fail once again in an ICC knockoutDavid Miller's fighting century in the semi-final against New Zealand had no bearing on the match as South Africa crashed out of Champions Trophy on Wednesday, March 5. On Wednesday, Miller scored his 3rd 50+ score in an ICC ODI knockout match.

Virat Kohli is the third-highest ODI run-scorer for 'England'. Here's how Champions Trophy: Virat Kohli has scored more runs in singles than any other batter since January 2000. The 36-year-old is the fourth-highest run-scorer in the tournament with a top score of 100 not out.

Rachin Ravindra's batting is beautiful to watch: Southee hails 'gifted' NZ starFormer New Zealand captain Tim Southee hailed Rachin Ravindra as a "gifted" batter, praising his work ethic and hunger for improvement. Ravindra's 108-run semi-final knock played a crucial role in New Zealand's Champions Trophy final qualification.

Watch: Virat Kohli gives heartwarming hug to retiring Steve Smith Champions Trophy 2025: Virat Kohli and Steve Smith shared a heartwarming moment after India won the semi-final on Tuesday at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium. Smith retired from ODIs after the semi-final

Alaistar Cook slams 'relaxed' England under coach Brendon McCullumAlastair Cook questioned England's relaxed approach under Brendon McCullum, which adds to the criticism faced by the side after their Champions Trophy failure. With Jos Buttler stepping down, many England greats suggest a need to rethink their training philosophy to compete at the highest level again.

Mushfiqur Rahim, Bangladesh's Mr. Dependable retires: ODI career in numbersChampions Trophy 2025: Veteran wicketkeeper-batter Mushfiqur Rahim retired from ODI cricket as Bangladesh's most-capped player and second-highest run-scorer in the format.

South Africa head coach proud of team's effort despite loss to New ZealandSouth Africa head coach Rob Walter commended his team's Champions Trophy campaign, emphasising that their semi-final loss to New Zealand does not overshadow their strong performances throughout the tournament. He urged fans to recognise their consistency despite one off-day.

Rachin Ravindra plays for the team first: Williamson on 'gifted' teammateKane Williamson praised Rachin Ravindra's match-winning century against South Africa in the Champions Trophy semi-final, highlighting the youngster's ability to play with both freedom and responsibility, which proved crucial in securing New Zealand's spot in the final.

Mushfiqur Rahim retires from ODIs after forgettable Champions TrophyChampions Trophy: Veteran wicketkeeper Mushfiqur Rahim drew the curtains down on his ODI career after Bangladesh failed to qualify for the semi-final of the mega event in Pakistan and Dubai.

Bring back reverse swing: Shami urges ICC to reconsider saliva ruleMohammed Shami called for ICC to lift the saliva ban, stressing its role in enabling reverse swing and adding excitement for bowlers, especially in ODIs, where rules have significantly reduced pacers' impact.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
